TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Purchase of motor oil, diesel fuel, and liquid gas

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Purchase of motor oil, diesel fuel, and liquid gas.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: In order to prove the ability to perform a professional activity, the economic operator should submit a document for registered activity as proof that it is registered as a natural or legal person for performing the activity related to the subject of the public procurement contract or evidence that it belongs to a suitable professional association in accordance with the regulations of the country where it is registered.
Evidence issued by a competent body for fulfilling the special conditions for performing the actions prescribed in accordance with the law that relates to the subject of the contract:
— — Eurosuper BS 98 and Extra light household EL-1.
These are issued by Regulatory Energy Commission of the Republic of Macedonia.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: To qualify as capable of carrying out the relevant public procurement contract in terms of its technical or professional capabilities, the economic operator must meet the following minimum requirements:
— experience in successfully executed contracts related to the subject of procurement in the last 3 years,
— technical possibility for use of non-cash payment system and,
— the provision, ie provision of a minimum of three gas stations within a radius of not more than 10 kilometers from the head office of the contracting authority.

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: The economic operator proves the fulfillment of the minimum requirements by submitting:

— list of successfully executed contracts related to the subject of procurement in the last three years, with values of contracts, dates of concluding, buyers (contracting authorities or economic operators), by providing a certificate for performed deliveries issued by the recipients or if such certificates cannot be provided for reasons beyond the control of the economic operator, only with his declaration of performed deliveries,
— a statement for using non-cash payment system, and,
— a statement of availability or provision of a minimum of three gas stations within a radius of not more than 10 km from the head office of the contracting authority.

USE_ELECTRONIC_AUCTION.P: The contracting authority will use the electronic auction as the last stage in the open procedure. The subject of the electronic auction is the total price including all costs and discounts and import duties, excluding VAT.

The initial price of the electronic auction is the lowest price of the eligible bids. Invitations to participate in the auction will be submitted in electronic form through ESPP after the full evaluation of the initial bids, to all economic operators that have submitted acceptable bids in the 1st phase of the procedure and which are registered in the ESPP.

The invitation to participate in the auction will be electronically sent to the mailbox of the user profile of the ESPP, to the person who will submit an offer for the appropriate procedure electronically.
The invitation to participate in the auction shall contain the following data:
— the starting price of the auction, ie the lowest price from the initially submitted tenders, the date and time of the commencement and completion of the auction,
— the interval in which the negative bidding will be conducted (minimum and maximum-difference in the offered prices).
If only one bid or only one acceptable tender is submitted, the contracting authority will invite the only bidder to submit a final price through the ESPP.

The final price submission invitation contains the following data: identification of the bid portion that will be the subject of submission of the final price, information available to it before the submission of the final price and the time period for submission of the final price.
The only bidder submits the final price at the set time only once, and if it does not submit the final price, the initially offered price will be considered final.

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: State Appeals Commission on Public Procurement
